page.title: 02PHYSICAL GEOGRAPHY
page.content: The{TEALING}district lies on the south facing slopes of the{SIDLAW HILLS.}The {GEOLOGY}consists of Old Red Sandstone with some minor igneous intrusions. The whole area has a covering of glacial sands and gravels which varies in thickness and composition. The area is drained by the{FITHIE BURN}and there is evidence that its valley has has been over deepened by the passage of post-glacial meltwater in the S.E. corner of the block. The{CLIMATE}is generally mild and sunny since it is sheltered from Northerly winds by the Sidlaws. However, relief creates a local frost and fog hollow in winter. The annual precipitation is 800 mm. but varies with altitude. {SOILS}derived from the ORS give light loams but the composition varies and can be stony in places where the glacial drift is coarse.
